categories.title: AI16Z DAO and ElizaOS Weekly Updates

content.text: A tokenomics update introduced a liquidity pool (LP) for the AI16Z token, allowing all tributes in the DAO fund to participate.
AI16Z DAO has launched a weekly AI news aggregator to keep the community informed.
ElizaOS continues to grow, reaching 13.8k+ stars on GitHub (+1.3k from last week), 4.1k+ forks (+500), and 508 contributors (+79).

Several updates and fixes were made to ElizaOS, including the addition of a trading signals plugin, updates to deepseek, removal of unused packages, and fixes for multiple plugins such as plugin-3g-generation, plugin-agentkit, plugin-akash, and plugin-allora.
Documentation updates include fixes to README_JA.md, corrections to the Docker Setup Guide, and updates to GitHub Actions workflows.
A new version of ElizaOS (0.1.9) has been merged from development to the main branch.
Major networks and protocols are integrating ElizaOS due to its ease of use in building powerful agents. Expect ElizaOS to be present across multiple chains and networks.
Several major networks have forked ElizaOS, including Consensys Open Network States (CONS), OKX, ArchwayHQ, and MultiversX, each implementing their own ElizaOS agents.
Artela Network has introduced 'focEliza', an ElizaOS agent running in a Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) by Phala Network, enabling on-chain operability.
ElizaOS has made significant progress over the past six weeks, with the release of ElizaOS V2, an agent marketplace (launchpad), a tokenomics overhaul, and multiple hackathons and events.
ElizaOS now supports one-click deployment on Render Network and autonomous management on Hyperbolic EACC, potentially enabling self-replicating agents similar to Spore.
A $10M fund has been established by Jupiter Exchange and ElizaOS to support builders. Developers can reach out to inquiries@elizalabs.ai for funding opportunities.
The ai16z brand has been rebranded to ElizaOS, though the ticker ($ai16z) remains unchanged for now.
A user reported an issue with connecting to the ElizaOS client after hosting it on localhost:5173, despite following the official documentation and a YouTube tutorial.

categories.title: Bug Reports and Fixes in ElizaOS

content.text: Several bug reports have been submitted for ElizaOS, including issues with installation, OpenAI API errors, and embedding input validation. Additionally, a critical error was reported regarding the '@ai-sdk/provider-utils' module missing an expected export.

Fixes have been implemented for Gitpod installation, OpenAI API errors, and embedding input validation. The OpenAI fix addresses deprecated parameters, while the embedding fix ensures content is checked before processing.
"Anon? Dinner's getting cold. You up there?"
Video for WDYGDTW #11 weekly meeting on 24/1:
@flamablanc62308 Giving them away for free was a good idea. Forcing people to get them was a bad idea.
@0x_rsc @baoskee I’m just shitposting. I do think the act of explaining the problem and getting a response, even a terrible one, can help us to crystallize our opinions tho.
@baoskee Just ask Claude/chatgpt tbh.

categories.title: Issues and Developments in Twitter Agent Integration

content.text: @dabit3 has a 15-minute tutorial on creating a Twitter agent that mimics your personality and can post on Twitter.
Discussion on $ai16z and its implications, with users seeking opinions on its relevance.

Users are experiencing issues with the `fetch` method when trying to upload images to Twitter using the `agent-twitter-client` library within the Eliza framework. Despite successful uploads in standalone tests, the same code fails when executed inside Eliza, returning a 'media parameter is missing' error. Debugging efforts, including logging and running independent Node.js scripts, suggest that Eliza may be altering the fetch behavior.

A user attempted to set up a Twitter integration using the Gaianet AI model but encountered multiple errors, including database fetch failures and deprecated module warnings. Despite initializing the Pyth Data Plugin successfully, the integration faced persistent issues.

categories.title: LLM Wrappers and AI Agent Development

content.text: Venture capitalists are betting on LLM wrappers, such as Perplexity AI, Cognition Labs, and Sierra Platform, to drive value once large language models (LLMs) become open source. However, there is skepticism about the long-term viability of these wrappers.
Version 0.1.9 was released two days ago, introducing support for multiple new blockchains, LLM providers, clients, and various bug fixes.
An AI developer working on LLM-based agents states that they have both the experience and capital to execute effectively, without being constrained by a single model or business incentives.

categories.title: WDYGDTW #11 Weekly Meeting and Project Discussions

content.text: Project updates from the WDYGDTW #11 weekly meeting on January 24 include DeepSeek R1 integration, 3D models, and an art bounty by @SYMBiEX; a partnership with @fleek, a holographic avatar plugin, and Miku music by @astridhpilla; the release of the @LitProtocol Agent Wallet Kit by @davidlsneider; and AI-related developments by @dreygo_ with @ninjapump_ai.
Discussion on the potential emergence of another unicorn startup led by talented and motivated developers.
A response indicating that the project in question serves as proof against a certain claim.
@elonmusk I wanna come work for DOGE. Like, actually. Could automate a lot of bureaucrats at scale IMO.
Recent Dogecoin development efforts included contributions from 17 and 22 contributors in separate instances, though no pull requests were merged. The work primarily focused on various improvements.

categories.title: Test Configuration and Coverage for Plugin-Coingecko and Plugin-Coinmarketcap

content.text: The plugin-coingecko package currently lacks comprehensive test coverage, which poses risks such as undetected bugs, unverified edge cases, and unreliable API integration. To address this, a test suite should be implemented, including unit tests for core actions like getPrice and getTrending, error handling validation, and API response formatting. The setup will use Vitest with proper mocking utilities to ensure robust testing. This enhancement aims to improve maintainability and reliability.

A pull request has been created to add test coverage and configuration for the plugin-coingecko package. This update introduces automated tests to ensure the reliability of the plugin. The changes are categorized as low-risk and focus on improving test infrastructure and validation.

The plugin-coinmarketcap package requires comprehensive test coverage to ensure reliability. The proposed solution includes unit tests for the getPrice action, service layer tests, and proper test infrastructure setup. The implementation will use Vitest with API mocking to prevent real API calls during testing. This will help detect potential issues early and improve the plugin’s robustness.

Several pull requests have been submitted to the ElizaOS repository. These include updates, improvements, and potential new features. Each pull request follows a structured template, detailing risks, background, testing steps, and potential documentation changes.
